intro: Phaca americana, commonly known as the American phaca, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. It produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
